data.title: 66th National Awards announced: Ayushmann, Vicky share Best Actor prize; 'Andhadhun' is best Hindi film
data.meta_description: Gujarati movie 'Hellaro' has won this year's Best Feature Film.
data.text:
Synopsis

Gujarati movie 'Hellaro' has won this year's Best Feature Film.

The 66th National Film Awards were announced on Friday, after a 3-month delay. The announcement of the awards was delayed due to the Lok Sabha Elections that were concluded in May. With the model code of conduct kicking into effect in April, the announcement had to be staggered as they could not have been done in the run-up to the General Elections.

A total of 31 awards were announced in the feature film category and 23 awards in the non-feature film category.

The National Award for Best Feature Film went to Gujarati movie 'Hellaro', based on women in Kutch. Vicky Kaushal and Ayushmann Khurrana shared the award for Best Actor for their performances in 'Uri' and 'Andhadhun' respectively, while Keerthy Suresh took home the National Award for Best Actress for the Telugu film 'Mahanati'.

Gujarati movie 'Hellaro' has won this year's Best Feature Film.

'Uri' director Aditya Dhar won in the Best Director category. The Indira Gandhi award for Best Debut Film of a director went to Marathi film 'Naal' by film-maker Sudhakar Reddy Yakkanti.

You Might Also Like:

'How's the Josh?' A retired Brigadier, chocolate and a Delhi army club behind 'Uri' blockbuster line

Surekha Sikri's performance in 'Badhaai Ho' won her the award for Best Supporting Actress, while lyricist-actor Swanand Kirkire bagged the award for Best Supporting Actor for Marathi film 'Chumbak'.

Surekha Sikri (L) won the Best Supporting Actress award for'Badhaai Ho'.

'Badhaai Ho' also won the Award for a Film Providing Wholesome Entertainment. Akshay Kumar's 'Padman' was awarded the Best Film on a Social Issue. Producer of the film Twinkle Khanna expressed her excitement on Twitter when she discovered the movie won.

Keerthy Suresh won the National Award for Best Actress for the Telugu film 'Mahanati'.

Sriram Raghavan's critically-acclaimed 'Andhadhun' won the award for the Best Hindi movie. Th film was also named winner in the Best Adapted Screenplay category.

Sriram Raghavan's 'Andhadhun' won the award for the best Hindi film.

Sanjay Leela Bhansali's 'Padmaavat', that was embroiled in controversy at the time of its release, was also recognised in the Best Choreography, Best Music Director categories. While Jyothi D Tommaar and Kruti Mahesh Madya won the choreography award for 'Ghoomar', Bhansali was awarded for music.

The complete list of winners in the feature film categories are:

Best Feature Film: 'Hellaro'

Best Actor: Vicky Kaushal, Ayushmann Khurrana

Best Actress: Keerthy Suresh

Best Director: Aditya Dhar

Best Music Direction: Sanjay Leela Bhansali for 'Padmaavat'

Best Supporting Actress: Surekha Sikri for 'Badhaai Ho'

Best Supporting Actor: Swanand Kirkire for Marathi film 'Chumbak'

Best Playback Singer(Male): Arijit Singh for 'Binte Dil Misriya Mein' from'Padmaavat'

Best Playback Singer (Female): Bindhu Malini for Kannada film 'Nathicharami'

Best Child Artist:

P V Rohith for Ondalla Eradalla(Kannada)

Sameep Singh for Harjeeta(Punjabi)

Talha Arshad Reshi for Hamid(Urdu)

Shrinivas Pokale for Naal(Marathi)

Sound Designer: Biswadeep Chatterjee for 'Uri'

Best Cinematographer: MG Radhakrishnan for 'Olu'

Best Lyrics: Manjunatha S for 'Maayavi Manave' from 'Nathicharami' (Kannada)

Best Screenplay: Rahul Ravindran for Telugu film 'Chi Arjun La Sow'

Film Providing Wholesome Entertainment: 'Badhaai Ho'

Best Film on a Social Issue: 'Padman'

Best Bengali Film: 'Ek Je Chhilo Raja'

Best Telugu Film: 'Mahanati'

Best Tamil Film: 'Baaram'

Best Rajasthani film: 'Turtle' directed by Dinesh Yadav

Best Malayalam Film: 'Sudani from Nigeria'

Best Assamese film: 'Bulbul Can Sing'

Best Marathi Film: 'Bhonga'

Best Kannada Film: 'Nathicharami'

Best Garo film: 'Maâ€™ama'

Best Background Music: Shashwat Sachdev for 'Uri: The Surgical Strike

Best Sound Design: 'Uri'

Best Action Direction (Stunt Choreography): Vikram More and Anbu Ariv for 'KGF' (Kannada)

Uttarakhand was announced the most film-friendly state.

The winners in the non-feature films category are:

Best Non-Feature film: 'Son Rise' and 'The Secret Life of Frogs'

Best Short Film: 'Kasab'

Best Film on Social Issues: 'Taala Te Kunjee'

Best Educational Film: 'Sarala Virala'

Best Film on Sports: 'Swimming through the Darkness'

Best Debut Film: 'Feluda: 50 Years of Ray's Detective'

Best Arts and Culture Film: 'Bunkar: The Last of The Varanasi Weavers'

Best Science & Technology Film: 'G.D Naidu: The Edison of India'

Best Environmental Film: 'The World's Most Famous Tiger'

Best Promotional Film: 'Rediscovering Jajam'

Best Film on Science and Technology: 'GD Naidu: The Edison of India'

The awards were announced by jury head Rahul Rawail. There is no clarity on when the awards will be presented

Last year, Sridevi and Vinod Khanna were conferred with the award posthumously.
